title: Deep neural networks for surface composition reconstruction from in situ exospheric measurements at Mercury
description: Complete study with simplified environment models, multiple processes, multiple networks, and multiple tasks introduction. First full paper of the chronological collection of manuscripts exploring the conceptual application of machine-learning algorithms for the reconstruction of Mercuryâ€™s surface composition from simulated exospheric measurements. Testing three DNN types: single MLP with hyperparameter optimization, 2xMLP in series, 2xMLP in a simple decision-split. Mineralogy (9 minerals) and elemental (11 elements) composition prediction  from exospheric elemental measurements; maps reconstruction and analysis. Simulated dataset - simplistic split and release processes (4 main processes - MIV, SP, PSD, TD), no complex exospheric dynamics.
